summary:
=== Purchase Information === Product Title: [Abib] Creme coating mask Tone-up solution 17g (5pcs) Review Date: 2020/08/08 Store: Abib Average Rating: 3.9 Product Details: {'Brand': 'Abib', 'Scent': 'Unscented', 'Number of Items': '5', 'Package Dimensions': '8.7 x 6.2 x 0.8 inches; 8.01 Ounces'} Review Text: Being a fan of a weekly face mask, I decided to try Abib Cream Coating Tone-Up Mask. Upon opening the mask the first time, I noticed it's an overpowering scent. After finishing the mask, I found my face broken out from the mask. The mask does seem to have a moisturizing effect, but I believe it is the fragrance that is the culprit of the allergic reaction. If your skin can handle fragrance, I would consider giving this mask a try; otherwise, I would hold off. Review Title: Nice Moisturizing Mask, but Heavy Fragrance Rating: 3.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: Easydew 2-Step Face Contour Sheet Mask - Tightening & Anti-Aging & Hydrating Korean Face Mask with DW-EGF, Hyaluronic Acid for Anti-Winkle, Reducing Fine Line & Producing Collagen (Qty 5) Review Date: 2020/08/09 Store: EASYDEW Average Rating: 4.4 Product Details: {'Brand': 'EASYDEW', 'Item Form': 'Sheet', 'Scent': 'Honey', 'Special Feature': 'Not Tested On Animals', 'Unit Count': '1.00 Count', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'Yes', 'Package Dimensions': '8.35 x 6.38 x 0.63 inches; 7.44 Ounces', 'Item model number': 'EETS1003', 'Manufacturer': 'CleveAid'} Review Text: Being on a face mask kick recently, I go the Easy Dew 2-Step Face Contour Mask to try out. Using the mask twice, I am really impressed by the effectiveness of this mask in terms of the smile lines and under-eye concentration masks. I genuinely can see a difference in my under eyes and the tightness of my face when I use this mask. Having tried another one of the 2-step masks, I do prefer the other mask set with the AHA acid peel for my younger skin. This mask, I think, would be a good option for those who have more mature skin, or who naturally have darker undereye areas. I found it really did brighten my under eyes. I would definitely give this mask a try if you want to focus on your undereye areas or want a boost of hydration in general. Review Title: Great Face Mask Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: CONTROL CORRECTIVE Clear Med 5% Acne Treatment Lotion. 2.5 Oz - Kills Acne Bacteria, Helps Clear & Control Breakouts, Benzoyl Peroxide, 3% Sulfur To Improve Efficacy And Dry Up Blemishes, Penetrates Review Date: 2021/01/13 Store: CONTROL CORRECTIVE SKIN CARE SYSTEMS Average Rating: 3.9 Product Details: {'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'Product Dimensions': '2 x 1.8 x 3.6 inches; 2.4 Ounces', 'Item model number': '815651010441', 'UPC': '815651010441', 'Manufacturer': 'Mainspring America, Inc. DBA Direct Cosmetics', 'Country of Origin': 'USA'} Review Text: The Clear Collective Acne Treatment Lotion was surprisingly effective for treating breakouts, though I wouldn't want to use this product regularly due to the smell. Originally applying this product, I applied it in the morning as I was getting ready for class and was immediately offended by the smell of sulfur on my upper lip. I had hoped that it wasn't noticeable to other people, but I never wore it again during the day.

While the smell isn't that great, the overall swiftness and effectiveness of this lotion make up for the smell. Instead of using this product during the day, whenever I experience a breakout, I apply this lotion at night, and my face visibly looks better the next morning. The lotion does have a slight sting to the face, but it isn't unbearable.

Overall, if you can stand the smell of sulfur just for a little while, it might be worth trying this product out to help with your acne. Review Title: Lingering Smell of Sulfur, but Very Effective Rating: 4.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: MIZON Cicaluronic Line, Cicaluronic Cleansing Balm, Makeup Remover, Centella Asiatica,Hyaluronic Acid, One Step Cleansing (2.7 fl oz) Review Date: 2021/02/02 Store: MIZON Average Rating: 4.5 Product Details: {'Package Dimensions': '2.99 x 2.91 x 2.05 inches; 6.74 Ounces', 'Item model number': '8809606850345'} Review Text: The Mizon Cicaluronic Cleansing Balm is a nicely hydrating balm that works well as a first cleanse in a skincare routine. With a price coming in around $17, it's hard to beat its value and quality. With an opaque light blue appearance in the container, it immediately turns into oil after rubbing it in your hands. This balm's scent reminds me of a beach scented candle, and I haven't noticed any irritation to the skin using this product. With calming and hydrating ingredients like Hyaluronic acid and Centella Asiatica, it plumps the skin and prepares it for the next step of your routine.

While I wouldn't recommend using this cleansing balm alone, it effortlessly removes any product or makeup on your skin throughout the day. With other cleansing balms for double or triple the price that perform similarly, I highly recommend trying out this cleansing balm in your routine. Even if you don't like the balm, you won't feel nearly as bad compared to buying a more expensive balm. Review Title: Great Value Cleansing Balm for any Skin Type Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: Karuna 7 Days of Glow - Face & Eye Mask Variety Pack (7 Sheets), Hydrate, Brighten and Glow Review Date: 2021/02/27 Store: Karuna Average Rating: 4.4 Product Details: {'Package Dimensions': '7.05 x 5.04 x 1.57 inches; 8.75 Ounces', 'UPC': '857950007333'} Review Text: Overall the Karuna 7 Days of Glow mask set has some good masks that do as they say without irritation. While I don't use face masks every day, it has taken me a while to use just a few of them, and specific masks, like the hydration mask, aren't best suited for my face type. Out of the whole set, my favorite masks have been the brightening and antioxidant masks. While I was slightly hesitant to use the antioxidant mask at first due to my oily combo skin, it left me with no clogged pores or irritation, and it brightened and soothed my skin.

As I mentioned initially, I don't use face masks too often, and the masks I usually use are pretty cheap. Trying these masks has ruined me a little because it will be hard to go back to my regular masks. The one thing I don't like about these masks is the price. I think $42 is a little bit much for seven face masks, but it depends on how often you use face masks and how much of a splurge you want them to be. in terms of quality, I think the Karuna masks are great. Review Title: High Quality Masks that Don't Irritate the Skin Rating: 4.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: GENSKIN Generation Skin Hydrating Marine Algae Eye Patches | Hydrate, Plump, Brighten Eye Area 180g/6.34 Oz - 30 pairs Review Date: 2021/03/17 Store: GENSKIN Average Rating: 4.5 Product Details: {'Brand': 'GENSKIN', 'Item Form': 'Patch', 'Product Benefits': 'Hydrating', 'Scent': 'Fresh', 'Skin Type': 'Dry', 'Product Dimensions': '3.14 x 3.14 x 1.57 inches; 5.93 Ounces', 'Item model number': '1220601'} Review Text: The Generation Skin Eye patches really impressed me, considering I initially thought this product was all about aesthetics. With an eye-catching color scheme and translucent blue jelly patches, I loved the look of the jar and color choice. With many eye patches I've tried sight unseen, I really wasn't sure how these would turn out, but I am overall very pleased with their performance. With ingredients like hyaluronic acid and vitamin-rich algae, they left my under eyes nicely moisturized, brightened, and plumped as though I hadn't stared at a screen for eight hours today.

Overall I very much enjoy this eye mask, and it feels that it really does work well in moisturizing the under eyes and with a price of $24.95 for 30 eye patches, it a great deal for now, though I have seen the eye patches at a higher price in the past. Review Title: Aesthetically Pleasing and Effective Rating: 4.0 --------------------------------------------------

First, identify consistent patterns in ratings and sentiments 2. Next, observe common themes across product purposes and use cases 3. Then, note recurring quality preferences and price sensitivity patterns 4. Finally, synthesize these observations into core preferences Remember to: - Focus only on keywords and trends supported by multiple interactions - Avoid repeating specific product names or details - Base conclusions strictly on the provided purchase data Here's the purchase data: === Purchase Information === Product Title: [Abib] Creme coating mask Tone-up solution 17g (5pcs) Review Date: 2020/08/08 Store: Abib Average Rating: 3.9 Product Details: {'Brand': 'Abib', 'Scent': 'Unscented', 'Number of Items': '5', 'Package Dimensions': '8.7 x 6.2 x 0.8 inches; 8.01 Ounces'} Review Text: Being a fan of a weekly face mask, I decided to try Abib Cream Coating Tone-Up Mask. Review Title: Aesthetically Pleasing and Effective Rating: 4.0 -------------------------------------------------- Structure your response as: SUMMARY: [Final synthesis of preferences and patterns]
raw_response:
SUMMARY:  
The shopper exhibits a clear preference for skincare products emphasizing hydration and anti-aging benefits, as seen in their consistent selection of hydrating face masks and treatments. They display a mixed sentiment towards products with strong fragrances, often indicating adverse reactions or preferences for unscented options. The consumer value quality and effectiveness, with a favorable rating trend towards products that visibly improve skin texture and hydration, such as eye patches and contour masks. Price sensitivity is noticeable, particularly regarding face masks, with some high-quality, expensive options causing hesitation. However, they seem willing to invest in cleansers and treatments that provide significant results, indicating a balance of quality versus price in their decision-making process. Overall, this individual prioritizes effective skincare solutions that cater to specific skin concerns, favors products with minimal or pleasant scents, and is mindful of spending, seeking high performance at reasonable prices.

target_interaction.title: Slightly Too Stripping , but it has a Nice Scent
target_interaction.text: The Bold Man Shampoo in the Califonia Love scent overall enjoyable, though I felt it was a little over stripping to my scalp. Typically I look for a happy medium of thoroughly cleaning my scalp without it being too harsh. While I was using this shampoo, I used a moisturizing conditioner to balance out the stripping nature. The scent has notes of coconut and other tropical ingredients, though it wasn't too overpowering. With a price of $17.99 when I am reviewing this shampoo, I find it to be a little too pricey for 250 ml. I expected more from the shampoo at this price point, but it still isn't terrible. Having tried other products from the brand, I know I kind of expected more from this conditioner.
target_interaction.title_meta: Bold Men, Shampoo 250 ml- Mens Daily Shampoo (California Love)
